bibl.title: Letter from H.H. Horner to Henry Rose Carter, February 29, 1916

div1.p: Horner discusses a hatchery at Edenton, North Carolina, for the breeding of mosquito-eating fish.

div1.head: Letter from H.H. Horner to Henry Rose Carter, February 29, 1916
div1.opener:
H. H. HORNER
SUPERINTENDENT
D. J. O'CONNELL
GENERAL AGENT
THE BIRMINGHAM WATER WORKS COMPANY
2114 FIRST AVENUE
Birmingham, Ala., 2/29/1916.
Dr. H. R. Carter, Ass't. Surgeon General,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Baltimore, Md.
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
I am very much obliged for your letter of
February 23rd, informing me of the establishment of a Fish
Hatchery at Edenton, N. C., for breeding mosquito-eating fish.

I have written to learn if a supply of these
fish may be obtained.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, H. H. Horner
Superintendent. WD/LM.
